trans-unit.source: How to Create Routes and Enable IP Forwarding in Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Create Routes and Enable IP Forwarding in Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage UDRs and IP forwarding
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage UDRs and IP forwarding

trans-unit.source: You can use virtual appliances in Azure to handle traffic in your Azure virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You can use virtual appliances in Azure to handle traffic in your Azure virtual network.

trans-unit.source: However, you need to create routes that will allow VMs and cloud services in your virtual network to send packets to your virtual appliance, instead of the desired destination for the packet.
trans-unit.target: However, you need to create routes that will allow VMs and cloud services in your virtual network to send packets to your virtual appliance, instead of the desired destination for the packet.

trans-unit.source: You also need to enable IP forwarding on the virtual appliance VM so it can receive and forward packets that are not addressed to the actual virtual appliance VM.
trans-unit.target: You also need to enable IP forwarding on the virtual appliance VM so it can receive and forward packets that are not addressed to the actual virtual appliance VM.

trans-unit.source: You can add, remove, and change routes in Azure by using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You can add, remove, and change routes in Azure by using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Before you can create a route, you must create a route table to host the route.
trans-unit.target: Before you can create a route, you must create a route table to host the route.

trans-unit.source: To create a route table named FrontEndSubnetRouteTable, run the following PowerShell command:
trans-unit.target: To create a route table named FrontEndSubnetRouteTable, run the following PowerShell command:

trans-unit.source: A route table must be associated with one or more subnets for it to be used.
trans-unit.target: A route table must be associated with one or more subnets for it to be used.

trans-unit.source: You can query Azure to see the actual routes applied for a specific VM or role instance.
trans-unit.target: You can query Azure to see the actual routes applied for a specific VM or role instance.

trans-unit.source: The routes shown include default routes that Azure provides, as well as routes advertised by a VPN Gateway.
trans-unit.target: The routes shown include default routes that Azure provides, as well as routes advertised by a VPN Gateway.

trans-unit.source: The limit of routes shown is 800.
trans-unit.target: The limit of routes shown is 800.

trans-unit.source: As previously mentioned, you need to enable IP forwarding on any VM or role instance that will act as a virtual appliance.
trans-unit.target: As previously mentioned, you need to enable IP forwarding on any VM or role instance that will act as a virtual appliance.
